content.question: ​The ancient Pythagoreans studied figurate numbers, which are numbers that can be shown by taking dots or spheres and arranging them into geometric shapes. For example, the square numbers are <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math>, <math alttext="9"><mn>9</mn></math>, <math alttext="16"><mn>16</mn></math>, <math alttext="25"><mn>25</mn></math>, etc., and each of these numbers of dots can be arranged into a square. The tetrahedral numbers similarly specify the number of spheres needed to create a tetrahedron, which is a triangular-based pyramid. The tetrahedral numbers are <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math>, <math alttext="10"><mn>10</mn></math>, <math alttext="20"><mn>20</mn></math>, <math alttext="35"><mn>35</mn></math>, <math alttext="56"><mn>56</mn></math>, <math alttext="84"><mn>84</mn></math>, etc. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: ​The tetrahedral numbers are best modeled by a quadratic function because the <math alttext="second"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>nd</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> differences are a nonzero constant.

​The tetrahedral numbers are best modeled by a quadratic function because the <math alttext="third"><semantics><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext>rd</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> differences are a nonzero constant.

​The tetrahedral numbers are best modeled by a cubic function because the <math alttext="second"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>nd</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> differences are a nonzero constant.

​The tetrahedral numbers are best modeled by a cubic function because the <math alttext="third"><semantics><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext>rd</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> differences are a nonzero constant.

content.answer: ​The tetrahedral numbers are best modeled by a cubic function because the <math alttext="third"><semantics><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext>rd</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> differences are a nonzero constant.
